channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘I keep getting the same song and dance’: My salary has not kept up with inflation. Is my company cheating me?
item.description: “If my salary had kept pace with inflation, I would be earning an additional $17,000 a year.”

item.title: ‘He is currently in jail’: My daughter’s husband has bipolar I disorder. Can he sign divorce papers?
item.description: “He opened credit cards in his name and spent every dime he could get his hands on, gambling and buying vehicles.”

item.title: The Fed risks a deflationary spiral by not cutting rates, these bond experts say
item.description: The Federal Reserve, by not cutting interest rates, is risking the creation of a deflationary downturn called a Kindleberger Spiral, a leading bond ma...

item.title: Chinese startup Z.ai launches powerful open source GLM-4.5 model family with PowerPoint creation
item.description: GLM-4.5’s launch gives enterprise teams a viable, high-performing foundation model they can control, adapt, and scale.

item.title: Apera AI closes Series A financing, updates vision software, names executives
item.description: Apera AI has raised funding from BDC and others, updated its 4D Vision controller software, and continued its expansion. The post Apera AI closes Seri...

item.title: Musician Adam Lambert sells Hollywood Hills home at a loss for $6.2 million
item.description: The American Idol runner-up listed the sprawling L.A. home, with a kitchen that is “pure drama,” for almost $7.4 million.

item.title: The two sides’ interpretations of the U.S.-E.U. trade deal are diverging already
item.description: Economists and observers have been quick to highlight discrepancies between the White House and the European Commission’s version of events.

item.title: No more links, no more scrolling—The browser is becoming an AI Agent
item.description: With rumors about a GPT-native browser, search is shifting from finding information to fulfilling tasks. No more links, no more scrolling.

item.title: What you may have missed about Trump’s AI Action Plan

item.title: This startup wants to use the Earth as a massive battery
item.description: Texas-based startup Quidnet Energy just completed a test showing it can store energy for up to six months by pumping water underground. Using water to...

item.title: Anthropic throttles Claude rate limits, devs call foul
item.description: Blaming users that run Claude Code 24/7, Anthropic instituted weekly rate limits for some Claude users resulting in backlash on social media.

item.title: How E2B became essential to 88% of Fortune 100 companies and raised $21 million
item.description: AI infrastructure startup E2B secures $21 million funding with 88% Fortune 100 adoption rate, powering secure AI agent deployments at scale.

item.title: Exploring the future of humanoid robotics with Novanta
item.description: Novanta discusses the development of the sensors, motors, and actuators necessary for the development of safe humanoids. The post Exploring the future...

item.title: When progress doesn’t feel like home: Why many are hesitant to join the AI migration
item.description: What happens if the AI migration accelerates and sizable portions of the workforce are slow to move out of fear, resistance or inability?
